trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModificationCollection"></xref> class contains a collection of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification"></xref> objects.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModificationCollection.#ctor"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModificationCollection"></xref> class.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModificationCollection.Add(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification)"></xref> method adds a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification"></xref> object to the collection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification"></xref> to add.
The zero-based index in the collection where the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification"></xref> was added.
attribute is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModificationCollection.AddRange(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification[])"></xref> method adds an array of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification"></xref> objects to the collection.
An array of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification"></xref> objects to add to the collection.
attributes is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
One of the members of attributes is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModificationCollection.AddRange(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModificationCollection)"></xref> method adds a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModificationCollection"></xref> object to the current collection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModificationCollection"></xref> collection to add to this collection.
attributeCollection is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModificationCollection.Contains(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification)"></xref> method determines whether this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModificationCollection"></xref> object contains a specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification"></xref> object for which to search.
`true` if the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification"></xref> is part of the collection; `false` otherwise.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModificationCollection.CopyTo(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification[],System.Int32)"></xref> method copies the entire collection to a one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.
Exceptions
Exception
Condition
ArgumentNullException
`array` is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
ArgumentOutOfRangeException
`index` is less than zero.
ArgumentException
`array` is multidimensional
-or-

The number of elements in the source <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModificationCollection> is greater than the available space from `index` to the end of the destination `array`.
InvalidCastException
The type of the source <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModificationCollection> cannot be cast automatically to the type of the destination `array`.
A one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModificationCollection"></xref> object.
The zero-based index of array where copying begins.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModificationCollection.IndexOf(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification)"></xref> method returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification"></xref> object in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModificationCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModificationCollection"></xref> object for which the index is returned.
The index value of the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification"></xref> object, if found; otherwise, -1.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModificationCollection.Insert(System.Int32,System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification)"></xref> method inserts a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification"></xref> object into the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModificationCollection"></xref> collection at the specified index.
The zero-based index in the collection at which to insert the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification"></xref> object to insert.
value is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
index is less than zero, or index is greater than the number of elements in the object.
The property contains the object at the specified index.
Exceptions
Exception
Condition
ArgumentException
You attempted to set the property to `null`.
The index value of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification"></xref> object.
The object at the specified index.
The method verifies that value is a object.
Exceptions
Exception
Condition
ArgumentException
`value` is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), or `value` is not a <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification> object.
The object to evaluate.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModificationCollection.Remove(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification)"></xref> method removes the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification"></xref> object from the collection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeModification"></xref> object to remove.
